page.title: 04HOMES & BUILDING MATERIALS
page.content: Leven is a typical East Yorkshire village.The older cottages which front the main road are built from bricks made from local clays.They are yellowish brown in colour. The local brick has a high salt content & many older buildings show salt marks, the brick also crumbles easily. The older properties have red pantiled roofs. About twenty years ago the village expanded on both sides of the A165 with two small residential housing developments.These are of three & four bedroomed semi-detatched & detatched houses & bungalows.These homes are built in red or yellow bricks with modern tiled roofs & gardens.There are 621 households in Leven 85% of which are owner occupied.
